title: Shōchū
summary: Shōchū (Japanese: 焼酎) is a Japanese distilled beverage. It is typically distilled from  rice (kome), barley (mugi), sweet potatoes (satsuma-imo), buckwheat (soba), or brown sugar (kokutō), though it is sometimes produced from other ingredients such as chestnut, sesame seeds, potatoes or even carrots.
